body:
I don't think we document one way or the other, really. How difficult would it be to support multiple uses? Apart from this particular issue there's little I can think of in any of the parsers that is stateful and/or needs to be reinitialized. 

Advantage of reusing a parser is that you get to retain any custom parser configuration.
There is a protected method call on the abstract parser class that should be done at the start of every parse method if we want to support it, IIRC.

it is actually documented that it needs to be called at the end of parse, but I would prefer if it were (also?) called at the start, given we aren't storing the bnodes in a map anymore and the rest of the storage doesn't explode in terms of memory usage.

issue.title: Blank node collision when loading JSON-LD

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.title: issue #745 : Clear parser state before/after parsing

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.body:
This PR addresses GitHub issue: #745 .

Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

* Consistently call AbstractRDFParser.clear before and after parsing to ensure state is consistent with the API goals of safely (not concurrently, just in serial) reusing RDFParser instances within the RDF-1.1 Abstract Model expectations
* Adds a test to ensure that the same blank node is parsed as two distinct objects by the same RDFParser across successive calls to RDFParser.parse

Signed-off-by: Peter Ansell <p_ansell@yahoo.com>

body: The PR for this is ready for review/merging, and would fix both this issue and #778 if merged, so could be useful to do before the next patch release
